DOC.brief_summary: Aims : To evaluate efficacy brief intensive intervention person mild cognitive impairment , assist family member friend . To equip person mild cognitive impairment specific skill prevent memory failure improve capacity patient family cope everyday memory difficulty .
DOC.brief_title: Impact Memory Group Older Adults Reporting Memory Difficulties
DOC.detailed_description: Participants : The sample consist 60 family family member report memory loss recently assess within Cognitive Dementia Memory Service ( CDAMS ) . Participants include patient family member / close friend . The potential patient participant must receive diagnosis mild cognitive impairment follow comprehensive clinical assessment . They must also English speaker , live community , evidence significant visual auditory impairment , history diagnose alcohol drug abuse major psychological disorder . Potential family / friend participant expect spouse adult child . Brief Description : Patients carers assign either 'brief intervention group ' 'no intervention group ' . Over 5 1 1/2 -hour weekly session , brief intervention group teach memory skill program emphasise practical strategy deal everyday memory problem . Interactive group discussion 'take home ' exercise also include . The intervention group serve control group , receive usual care memory clinic . At completion study , brief intervention offer intervention group . All participant complete questionnaire knowledge memory technique , common memory behaviour problem emotional health pre-intervention , post-intervention 3-month follow-up . Methods Data Analysis : Outcome evaluation monitor neuropsychological assessment memory performance , subjective self-reports . A 2 x 3 multivariate analysis variance ( MANOVA ) use assess difference experimental measure group ( brief intervention , intervention ) across repeat assessment phase ( pre-intervention , post-intervention , 3-month follow-up ) .
